coupon.title: Redeem Coupon
coupon.subtitle: Enter your promo code to unlock special offers and discounts

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.howToUse: How do I use a coupon code?
faq.howToUseAnswer: Simply enter the code in the field above and tap 'Redeem'. The discount or offer will be applied immediately to your account.
faq.whereToFind: Where can I find coupon codes?
faq.whereToFindAnswer: Coupon codes are shared through our social media, email newsletters, and special promotions. Follow us to stay updated!
faq.expired: What if my coupon code has expired?
faq.expiredAnswer: Expired codes cannot be redeemed. Check the validity period and try to use codes before they expire.
faq.multipleUse: Can I use multiple coupon codes?
faq.multipleUseAnswer: Generally, only one coupon code can be active at a time. New codes will replace previously applied discounts.

quotes.consistency: Consistency is the key to success.

breakfast.title: Breakfast Time! 🌅
breakfast.body: Don't forget to track your breakfast for a healthy start to your day.

lunch.title: Lunch Time! 🍽️
lunch.body: Time for lunch! Remember to scan your meal.

dinner.title: Dinner Time! 🌙
dinner.body: Your dinner awaits! Don't forget to track it in Kaloriq.

snack.title: Snack Time! 🍎
snack.body: Time for a healthy snack! Track it in Kaloriq.

inactivity.title: Time to track! ⏰
inactivity.body: You haven't scanned anything today. Open Kaloriq and track your meals!

educational.title: Educational Purpose Only
educational.content1: Kaloriq is designed solely for educational and informational purposes. This app serves as a general educational tool about nutrition and calorie tracking.
educational.content2: This application does not replace professional medical, dietary, or nutritional advice. For health concerns or specific dietary needs, please consult with a qualified physician, nutritionist, or registered dietitian.
educational.warning: Always consult a professional for medical advice

barcodes.title: Barcode Scans
barcodes.description: Nutritional information for barcode scans is provided by Open Food Facts, an open database of product information from around the world.

ai.title: AI Photo Recognition
ai.description: Food photo scans are analyzed using artificial intelligence to identify foods and estimate nutritional values.
ai.note: AI estimates may be inaccurate and should be considered approximations

accuracy.title: Accuracy & Disclaimer
accuracy.content1: While we strive to provide accurate information, we cannot guarantee the completeness or accuracy of nutritional data. Accuracy may vary due to:
accuracy.point1: Differences in product formulations and regional variations
accuracy.point2: Limitations of AI recognition in photo scans
accuracy.point3: User input and portion size estimations
accuracy.content2: Use this information as a general guide and do not rely solely on this data for critical nutritional decisions.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.content1: Scanned images may be processed on our servers to improve recognition quality, but images are not stored permanently. Only derived nutritional data needed for tracking is retained.
privacy.content2: For more information, please see our Privacy Policy.

contact.title: Contact
contact.content: For questions about data sources or accuracy concerns, please contact us:

calories.title: Calories
calories.aboutText: Calories are the unit of energy your body gets from food. A balanced relationship between consumed and burned calories is crucial for weight management.
calories.tip1: Eat nutrient-dense foods instead of empty calories
calories.tip2: Pay attention to portion sizes and eat mindfully
calories.tip3: Distribute your meals evenly throughout the day
calories.tip4: Drink enough water to distinguish hunger from thirst

protein.title: Protein
protein.aboutText: Protein is essential for muscle building, tissue repair, and many body functions. Adequate protein intake supports metabolism and keeps you fuller longer.
protein.tip1: Combine different protein sources like meat, fish, legumes
protein.tip2: Distribute protein evenly across all meals
protein.tip3: Choose lean protein sources to save calories
protein.tip4: Supplement with plant proteins for complete amino acid coverage

carbs.title: Carbohydrates
carbs.aboutText: Carbohydrates are the main energy source for your brain and muscles. Complex carbohydrates provide sustained energy and important nutrients.
carbs.tip1: Choose whole grains instead of refined carbohydrates
carbs.tip2: Eat plenty of vegetables and fruits for natural carbohydrates
carbs.tip3: Avoid too many sugary drinks and snacks
carbs.tip4: Timing matters - more carbs before workouts

fats.title: Fats
fats.aboutText: Healthy fats are important for hormone production, vitamin absorption, and brain function. Not all fats are equal - choose unsaturated fats.
fats.tip1: Prefer unsaturated fats from nuts, seeds, and fish
fats.tip2: Limit saturated fats from processed foods
fats.tip3: Use olive oil or avocado oil for cooking
fats.tip4: Eat fatty fish regularly for omega-3 fatty acids
